graphicslib3D

Interface IQuarterPatch

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ISurfacePatch
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    QuarterPatch

    public interface IQuarterPatch
extends ISurfacePatch
    This interface specifies the methods which must be implemented by classes in order to be editable by the "QuarterPatchDialog" class. Normally the implementing class is a cubic Bezier "quarter surface patch" defined by 4 control points representing a cubic Bezier curve whose values are stored in the object and where the surface is defined by rotating (sweeping) the Bezier curve 90 degrees about the Y axis.

    Implementing this interface allows an object to be cast into a form which can be passed to a QuarterPatchDialog object; that is, it allows any user-written object to use the QuarterPatchDialog editor to alter the contents of the object. See the QuarterPatchDialog class for a description of how to use the object-editing capabilities of that class.

    Version:
    4.3 02/23/06
    Author:
    John Clevenger

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Vector getControlPointVector()
      Returns a Vector containing the control points for the curve which is rotated about Y to define this patch.
      int getMaxRecursionLevel()
      Returns the current maximum recursion level (resolution) which is used to generate polygons representing this quarter patch.
      java.lang.String getPatchName()
      Get the name of the patch.
      void setControlPointVector(java.util.Vector newVector)
      Specify a new set of control points for the curve defining this quarter patch.
      void setMaxRecursionLevel(int newLevel)
      Specify a new recursion level to be used in generating polygons for this quarter patch.
      void setPatchName(java.lang.String newName)
      Specify a new name for this quarter-surface patch.

      • Methods inherited from interface graphicslib3D.ISurfacePatch

        getControlMesh, setControlMesh
